• Exclusion criteria
More than one (>1) previous chemotherapy regimen.
Treatment with chemotherapy, biological agents or targeted agents
In the previous 4 weeks.
Previous treatment with sorafenib or ixabepilone.
Pregnant or lactating women.
- Neuropathy (motor or sensory) greater than Class 1.
• Uncontrolled intercurrent disease, including (but not limited to)
Current or active infection >grade 2.
• Known history of human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), hepatitis
B, or hepatitis C infection.
• History of other malignant breast cancer tumours
• The curative intent within 5 years prior to enrolment in the study with
The exception of in situ cervix carcinoma, non-melanoma

- Exclusion criteria:
Results: Measurement from the first day of administration of the study drug to disease progression as defined by the criteria for assessing response in solid tumours (RECIST) - progression is defined as a 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of the target lesions, or a measurable increase in an untargeted injury, or the occurrence of new lesions
Time limit: every 9 weeks until treatment is discontinued or death under study
Title of the arm/group: Sorafenib and Ixabepilone
Description of the arm/group: Targeted oral therapy and systemic chemotherapy
